review_title: A great company before the heartless lay offs
pros:
- Average salary wise, but based on the country you reside in and your role. 
- Fully remote work. 
- Global onsite so you get to travel internationally at times, sponsored for you but not your family
- Equipment budget to set up your home office. 
- Supportive, kind, genuine friends and teammates. 
- Professional colleagues with extensive experiences that you can learn a lot from. 
- Flexible working hours but usually people from other regions always have to cater to the US/Canada time zone, and also their timezone. 
- Ramadan and dhul hijjah bonus like $1000 in total for a year.
cons:
- will fire people anytime they want. You get a video call from the manager out of the blue saying that it's your last day, then they’ll just cut off all access to slack, etc. 
- give severance pay for 2 months and are VERY proud of it. 
- the reason for the lay off is because they don’t find you relevant anymore. Like they don’t know where to put you, or they developed a new goal, then they cut you off. Saying things like they don’t want to hold you back from thriving elsewhere. 
- no performance review but make it as one of their justifications to fire people.
- lay off without warning, and regardless of the employees current situation. Pregnant, supporting family members or even if you are a senior etc.
- romanticising working extra hours. 
- health benefits only for those in the US. 
- keep collecting employee feedback but hardly addressed any effectively. 
- hires globally and expecting people to have global skills, but pay them based on local pay. 
- have to work extra hours and cater to Western time zone while being paid little, especially for underpaid countries. 
- a senior can be paid less than junior, meanwhile being assigned to a much more complex tasks. 
- no salary raise at all despite extra hours and good performance. 
- high turnover rate. 
- spend too much on traveling and onsite (mostly for top leaders), but are hesitant to revise the employees salary.

pros: Make great likeminded work-friends, occasional meal perks and small bonuses. Remote work, flexible hours and unlimited days off.
cons: Job insecurity, high turnover at the marketing department, no trust in your abilities, little to no opportunities to grow and advance, leadership needs to get organized. There is favoritism among certain staff who can hop around in job positions endlessly while others are hanging on to their life, hoping they don't get fired tomorrow.

review_title: Great place to work for driven and talented individuals
pros: - Leadership really encourages open feedback and ideas - Great people across the company with shared values - You give great, you receive great! Unfortunately, some people mistake this as an 'easy Muslim job' and expect to get away with the bare minimum and low standards - You feel valued and supported
cons: - None that I can think of, people have different experiences but as long as you are doing your job to a high standard, you will really enjoy your time here

pros: Muslim Friendly Amazing colleagues Considerate Fulfilling job Make a difference in the world Excellent work culture Amazing Management Team Senior leadership Team is great and responsive You really feel like your voice is heard when speaking of an issue
cons: Pay is on the lower side and could be higher

review_title: When your workplace is one of the best parts of your life...
pros:
Working at LaunchGood has been a life changing experience. The amount of GOOD that LaunchGood provides the world is just the tip of the iceberg. I want to talk about the amount of GOOD it has provided for me personally.

I'll start with the fact that working on a team where the leadership is comprised of 50% females (who are women of color) has really been eye opening. These women are admirable and accomplished, and bring a specific insight to business that I have not experienced in a work place before. The entire leadership team are people I admire for different reasons, and those specific reasons are woven into their everyday interactions with our whole team. Our team members are valued and respected by leadership, and the environment they have created includes making sure we team members are a part of every step of the LaunchGood process. 

While LaunchGood is definitely a faith based organization, we have team members who are not Muslim. Why is this important? Because what they can relate to are LaunchGood's values that are at the forefront of everything we do. It's not about religion, it's about a code that we all live by in our personal lives that we can bring to work every, single day. Doing good and helping people in need are universal concepts that each team members holds dear to their heart. 

Perhaps the most important thing to me about working at LaunchGood is how we have the freedom and flexibility to live our lives in an organic way. I do work 9-5 but when there are things that I need to get done during the day that have nothing to do with work, I have the support and trust from my team to let me manage my schedule in a way that provides great work-life balance. This level of trust in me is higher than any other place I have ever worked at.
cons: Working remotely can sometimes make us feel isolated from our team members. While there's certainly a distance between us that working in an office does not have, we mitigate this by being super social with each other in our daily interactions.

pros:
- Great company culture
- Rooted in Islamic faith and values
- Lots of opportunities to learn and grow in your role
- Face paced environment that gets you to learn and experience a lot
- Get to be part of the scaling of the company 
- Work is meaningful, serves a purpose
cons: - Smaller company so benefits and salary still catching up to industry standards. Lots of progress made in past years.

review_title: Tech company that pays like a charity / NFP
pros:
Good team members overall
Unlimited vacations
Remote 
Friends all over the world
Retreats are fun with cool locations
cons:
Pays like another for profit or charity with no salary increases or adjustments for inflation 

If you’re looking for an Islamic culture, then with bad apples who have higher positions/ sway leadership suck all that away. 

No risk taking to grow, no faith in team members to try new strategies

Never able to turn off

review_title: FOR PROFIT company is poorly run
pros:
Work from home
You get medical insurance only for yourself as a benefit but that's it..
cons:
Toxic culture and drama in many departments.
Most year-to-year growth is not due to the hands of it's employees but rather social media and a few key influencers.
Muslims organizations are preferring other low-fee or no-fee platforms instead of this high fee one. 
The millions from fees goes to salarys of excessive employees which could be used to help people instead. 
Benefits are bad. They expect you to be ok with less yet it is a FOR PROFIT organization racking in millions from fees. This money is justfied by saying their platform needs to grow. When is the growth enough? Its just like any corporation with greed.

review_title: Purpose driven with a big vision
pros: I love working somewhere that's value-aligned and genuinely wants to help make the world a better place.
cons: You need to be comfortable working in a global remote team.
